headline: Military Police Can Carry Firearms on Marine Bases
abstract: The Marine Corps said it expedited the policy change after recent fatal shootings at Navy installations in Pensacola, Fla., and at Pearl Harbor in Hawaii.
lead_paragraph: The United States Marine Corps announced this week that it had authorized military police officers to bring their privately owned firearms onto bases, a rule change that senior officers said was hastened by fatal shootings at two Navy installations in the past month.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces
